title: Conference Championship Recap, 49ers-Chiefs set for Super Bowl LIV (Football 1/20)
description:
Will Brinson is joined by Ryan Wilson and John Breech to recap the AFC and NFC Conference Championship games. The guys start with analysis of the Chiefs 35-24 victory over the Titans, to advance to their first Super Bowl in 50 years (3:45). They highlight the outrageous play of Patrick Mahomes, another slow start for Kansas City and a limited Derrick Henry. Next, a breakdown of the 49ers commanding 37-20 win over the Packers to secure a trip to Miami (34:10). Will, Ryan and John give credit to Raheem Mostert for a historic performance and evaluate the game and season from Green Bay and Aaron Rodgers. Next, an early Super Bowl LIV preview on how the Chiefs and 49ers match up (1:09:00), before winners and losers from Sunday (1:23:30) 
 
To learn more about listener data and our privacy practices visit: https://www.audacyinc.com/privacy-policy
